review: I ordered one as soon as they became available, but just recently plugged it in and started using it. The interface is user friendly and I like having a physical remote, but the wireless antenna in the devise sucks. I unplugged my chromecast stick and plugged this in to the TV and can't even stream netflix without moving the TV closer to the wireless access point - even though it shows near full signal strength. I am going to have to buy an HDMI extender cable to be able to place the stick 6ft closer to the wireless to get it to work propperly
author: Richard Reaksecker

review: Great little device. Picture quality for prime content and YouTube doesn't seem to have the quality as ps3 connected to tv for same content. Still good quality. I would give it five stars if I didn't have to have the power cord running to it or if it would have came with a longer cable so I could run it through wall and hidden like my other cables.

review: As an early adopter (Nov 2014), I was expecting a product with a few hiccups out of the box. While I can't get the miracast support to work right (I don't really need it anyway, but I'm a tinkerer), it's done a stellar job at everything else. I used to rely on my Tivo for amazon video, no more.
